title: 113_hr2866
content: The Act may be cited as the "Boys Town Centennial Commemorative Coin Act". Boys Town is a nonprofit organization founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska. It serves children of all races and religions and has expanded to 11 regions across the country. Father Flanagan's work gained global recognition after the success of the 1938 movie "Boys Town". President Truman asked Father Flanagan to spread his message worldwide after World War II. Boys Town, Nebraska, founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan, serves children of all races and religions. The Boys Town National Hotline counsels over 150,000 callers annually. The Boys Town National Research Hospital specializes in hearing care and Usher Syndrome research. Programs impact 2,000,000 children and families yearly. The 100th anniversary of Boys Town is on December 12th, 2017. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half dollar clad coins in honor of the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town. The coins will have specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions as outlined in the Act. The coins minted under this Act will be legal tender and considered numismatic items under specific sections of title 31, United States Code. The design of coins minted under this Act will symbolize 100 years of Boys Town, a nonprofit child care agency. Each coin will feature the coin's value, the year 2017, and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with Boys Town and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens of Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from January 1, 2017, to December 31, 2017, at a designated Mint facility. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value plus the cost of designing and issuing them. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. Sales of coins under this Act will include surcharges: $35 for the $5 coin, $10 for the $1 coin, and $5 for the half dollar coin. Surcharges received will be paid to Boys Town for their cause. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure minting coins won't cost the government. No funds will be disbursed until all costs are recovered.
